fields.description: The supposedly better looking diff view in 1.9 makes it harder to distinguish hunks. I don't mind the changed colors, but I do object to the removal of borders between hunks. Unlike the extraneous and cluttering lines between filenames introduced in 1.9, the separators in 1.8.1 had a purpose -- they helped you very quickly see the hunks. Please do something so that this is once again the case.
fields.summary: Hunks all run together in 1.9 diff view

fields.description: In 1.8.1, the Recent Messages dropdown had an understandable name and was toward the top of the commit pane. In 1.9, it has nonsensical icon and has been moved to the bottom. The latter is a bigger problem as good commit messages tend to be long, developers tend to maximize windows, and the list shows many previous messages. The result is that the menu always comes up to the left of the button (not where you're looking) and only shows a subset of the items until you move the cursor to the bottom (and everything shifts). In both cases, it is not nearly as smooth as it was before. Please fix.
fields.summary: Move commit message history button to the top

fields.description: In 1.8.1, the staging area and the unstaged files scrolled independently. This was very, very useful when you had a lot of pending changes. As of 1.9, they scroll together, which means you can no longer see staged and unstaged files at the same time. Why? Please fix.
fields.summary: Fix scrolling for staging area

fields.description:
The Amend Commit checkbox should not be hidden in a menu.

1) It's hidden and it's multiple steps to choose it
2) There is no on-screen indication of when it is turned on
3) If you subsequently turn it off, there is no visible indication at all that it has been turned off (e.g., the overridden commit message does not revert).
4) It's hard to find for new users.

I cannot think of any rationale for hiding this option. In fact, why hide anything in that menu?
fields.summary: Restore Amend Commit checkbox

fields.description:
Please bring back the filename view, which showed filenames in one column and path names in another column. The full path view is significantly less usable, especially in any project with deep directory structure.

While you're at it, the previous look of the list view, with gray bars and tighter space, was much more readable. The horizontal lines serve no purpose except to make things harder to read.
fields.summary: Bring back filename view

fields.description: The new checkmark system is confusing (and buggy sometimes, can't repro stuff though). Also dragging a lot of files from working to staged doesn't work anymore.
fields.summary: Bring back staged and working tree boxes.

fields.description:
After upgrading to 1.9, changes that I made were staged automatically.

NOTE: This might be an upgrade-only issue. I saw it when upgrading from 1.8.1 to 1.9, then I did not see it again after going back to 1.8.1 and then upgrading to 1.9 again. Since I've seen a complaint about the "Use Staging Area" option being off by default in 1.9, this could be related to that problem.
fields.summary: Changes look like they're staged automatically after upgrading to 1.9

fields.description:
I can no longer see the index nor the staging areas.

If no file is modified, the view just shows up empty. If at least one file is modified, either the diff for it is displayed, or two awkward black squares appear.

This just happened without me doing anything, so I don't have steps to repro. I don't know if it's due to a setting I could've accidentally modified, but I don't think so.

I tried wiping preferences (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/Wiping+SourceTree+Preferences) and reinstalling SourceTree without success.
fields.summary: File Status View missing index and staging areas

fields.description:
In the File Status pane in the Log view (CMD+2), there is a "..." button next to each file in the pane.  When clicked, the menu that is displayed cuts off text to the right and the top menu item is barely visible.

In addition, the menu from the File changes pane (one the left) uses a completely different control styling than the menu from the "..." button in the Diff pane (on the right).

I've attached screenshots to illustrate both issues.
fields.summary: "..." button in file status pane in log view cuts off menu contents
File action menu in "File Status View" has items cut off

fields.description:
Hosted Repositories works with my Bitbucket account, but when it tries to connect to my Github account it fails with an error sheet:

Login error
Login failed for your GitHub account.
The remote service said: 'Login error'

I've triple-checked that I entered the correct password.
I'm using two-factor authentication on Github; maybe SourceTree doesn't work correctly with that?
fields.summary: Hosted repositories "login error" with Github

fields.description:
* Commit in one branch
* Switch branches
* Make change to a file
* Click on "Working Copy"
* Click in field to start a new commit

*Shows last commit branch*
fields.summary: Commit view shows incorrect branch for commit

fields.description:
This happened after installing GitHub for Mac and creating a new user email for commits (first time ever).

*Fix*
Unchecking "use global user settings" under repository settings will fix in this case.
fields.summary: Incorrect user listed when creating new commit or settings menu incorrect.

fields.description: When viewing a file in the diff view, there are no longer any horizontal scroll bars. There does not seem to be any way to view the entire line.
fields.summary: Horizontal scrollbars not showing up in diff

fields.description:
I would like for a visual utility to diff commits to be built into sourcetree.

While a bit outdated and no longer under development, this program provides a good example if you look at the d (delta) view in the top left corner:
http://jasonfharris.com/machg/
fields.summary: Version Diff

fields.description: I would like if there were a way to see annotated files like thg annotate. That shows the commits and users that modified lines in a file.
fields.summary: Annotate file

fields.description:
The new commit view (the check mark at the top left) is very disappointing. I liked being able to browse the folders, and now that it is all just one huge list it is fairly overwhelming especially if there are a lot of files. I preferred the old browser setup greatly.

While it is a bit dated and no longer under development you may want to take a look at how machg does things. It is quite well designed, though both sourcetree and machg have their pros and cons.

http://jasonfharris.com/machg/
fields.summary: 1.9 update Commit View disappointing

fields.description:
File status -> Working copy does not have the Tree View any longer. It's all flat.

It is extremely hard to navigate using this kind of flat list. I am not sure why would you completely get rid of the tree view. If nothing else - it should be an option. The product is called "source TREE" after all, but now I can only see my source in flat form :)
fields.summary: File status pane is flat now!

fields.description:
Just downloaded latest release --- the tree view in file status pane seems to be gone. That was a MAJOR useful view for structuring purposes.

Please, bring it back ASAP
fields.summary: Arrrggg---- the tree view is gone

fields.description:
When adding new files to the repo in the "working copy" view, SourceTree displays incorrect information for yet-unstaged files with more than 101 lines.

The content preview for such files is truncated to exactly 100 lines (with another one below containing "...") and SourceTree reports the total line count as 101. As soon as you stage the file and check its preview again, SourceTree displays the correct higher line count (file preview also isn't truncated).
fields.summary: Incorrect line counts displayed for long files before adding/staging

fields.description:
The new look of the 1.9 interface when staging files and looking and diffs is a major step backwards on the mac.

For file lists: always showing the full path is almost always a bad presentation choice. It's not communicating the change set very well, especially for any real world project that has more than 1-2 levels of directories in it. Please allow to display the column as file names only, like before. 

The additional separating lines and padding around the cells don't help. It's visual noise and just distracting.

For diffs (hunks) on the right: The added padding again just adds visual noise that distracts from looking at the diff. I wish there was a way to get rid of it.
fields.summary: Allow reverting to pre-1.9 file list and hunk view

fields.description:
I really love the new look of SourceTree 1.9, but there is one change that I would like to turn off.  Now in the view of local files, it always shows the full path of the file.  When working with a large project with many submodules, the control becomes unreadable (image1)   In all but the rarest cases, I don't need to see " "core/bundles/ticket/src/main/java/com/tradingscreen/ticket/" repeated over and over again.  

And while you've give the ability to sort by file name, visually trying to find the file your are looking for is extremely difficult when your eye has to track through the full paths.

I'm really hoping there is a setting to turn this off, though I couldn't find one.
fields.summary: SourceTree: Local file window now shows full path

fields.description:
Would be nice bring back the previous display from v1.8, where the filename was also displayed, not only the path. In big repos, the paths become irrelevant. E.g. http://monosnap.com/image/IyJjVo8gnhUHtDcmBY93iZklE0jPhM#

I don't know if this is related, but that entire staging panel has a strange behaviour when resizing it's width. It doesn't retain the width I set by dragging the vertical separator.
fields.summary: Show filenames & paths in staging panel

fields.description:
Please move the amend last commit back to its original spot so it can be more easily accessed.
On our team, this is used very frequently...
fields.summary: Amend last commit only accessible from the menu during a commit

fields.description:
This issue kept occurring on the previous version of Sourcetree for Mac, but has reared it's ugly head on the new 1.9.0 version.

It usually happens when I'm trying to stage files - the loading spinner shows, the file doesn't stage, then Sourcetree crashes.  It seems sporadic, so I can't give instructions on how to recreate.

Attached is a crash report.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashing

fields.description: On doing my first stage (a hunk) using SourceTree 1.9,0, this bubble popped up ("You've staged some changes!"), but it's contents are too big to display. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Bubble contents cropped

fields.description:
Due to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1469 , the shortcut key CMD+SHIFT+L has been changed to hide/show the side bar.

Need to change back CMD+SHIFT+L to be the shortcut key for Repository Pull button and set a new shortcut key for hide/show side bar.
fields.summary: Shortcut key for Repository Pull missing

fields.description:
In some case the popover for the actions (stage, unstage, etc) has a wrong size and some options result hidden.
(see the attache file)
fields.summary: Wrong popover size hide some options

fields.description:
I mostly like the UI updates in 1.9, but the loss of tree view for files is a regression for me.

- It's harder to identify the actual file names (because they appear at the end of a long string)
- Many filenames are now cut off due to long paths in projects with a large hierarchy of folders

I understand the flat view simplifies sorting, but for me it does more harm than good.
fields.summary: Bring back tree view for file list

fields.description:
I moved a file and could stage the moved change, but then made some changes to the file and couldn't stage those changes. There was just a spinning activity indicator and then nothing.

Staging the changes in git worked, but they aren't reflected in the pending files view.
fields.summary: Can't stage moved file with changes

fields.description: Using space bar to check/uncheck files to commit causes a flicker and does not work. Video attached to demonstrate.
fields.summary: Checked-state of selected items will not toggle with space bar

fields.description:
When I have changes in my staging area, I cannot right-click "commit" as I am used. Not even a short cut is available and for some reason the menu-bar item is gray (see screenshot).

The only way to commit is to move my mouse to the commit button and click. 

I really hate to click.
fields.summary: Forced to use "Commit"-Button

fields.description:
In my diffs, last line is not visible. Please see screenshots.

The last line is my actual change in this case.

Marking as major because I was forced to check back on command line if things are ok
fields.summary: Last line of diff not visible

fields.description:
Please restore External Diff back as a standalone button. As of SourceTree 1.9.0 it is buried in a pop-up menu. I use it constantly and it is frustrating having it buried.

I also feel that External Diff is not a natural fit for that menu. Most or all of the other items in it are preferences -- as one would expect, given the gear icon. External Diff is not a preference, it is an action.
fields.summary: Please un-bury the External Diff button

fields.description:
I just tried upgrading to SourceTree 1.9.0 and was horrified to realize that the diff panel always shows the diff for the first file in the list (in the panel to the left of the diff panel), regardless of which file I select in the list.

I have reverted to 1.8.1 for now.
fields.summary: Diff panel shows diff for first file in list, regardless of which file is selected

fields.description: The '...' menu is broken, and also missing the first 'Stage file' option
fields.summary: Broken '...' Menu

fields.description:
Why needed:

There are tools devs use to monitor the file system of their projects (such as css compilers etc such as Codekit for OSX) and these tools are monitoring for user-initiated changes (file saves etc).

Unfortunately they cannot distinguish between these changes and changes initiated by a branch checkout of pull request, so we find ourselves having to manually stop these monitors by hand each time the project is updated (or risk git "cannot update because file is changes/untracked" errors... a real P in the A).

Therefore we really need a way of stopping these other apps from monitoring the projects during a checkout/pull in an automated way.

Why is this a problem for Sourcetree?:

Git has no concept or a pre-pull/checkout hook that a dev can create against a project, so the normal way to do this is to create a custom script on the terminal that does this and then does the checkout etc. Unfortunately this isnt possible with Sourcetree as we have no way to tell it to run a specific script instead of running the standard "git checkout" command.

Therefore my idea is for a solution that would utilise the existing "custom actions" feature already present in Sourcetree. What would be needed would be an alternative (repo-specific?) option that essentially says (before checkout / before update, run custom action "x" , and after, run custom action "y").

While this isnt an option that would appeal to everyone, it would give some users far greater control and flexibility of how they can manage their repos, and give much flexible integration with other tools in a developer's workflow (without actually having to do any specific integration with other apps).
fields.summary: Allow for a scriptable "pre-update/checkout/pull" hook

fields.description: In French version of SourceTree, when pulling or pushing there is a checkbox "Afficher le résultat complèt" (ie: display complete result), but in French, the word is spelled "complet", without the accent.
fields.summary: Spelling Error in French Version

fields.description:
In the file status view, when the "files in working tree" list is longer than the visible region, it is difficult to do multiple operations in sequence for the items in the bottom of the list (i.e. the items for which you have to scroll towards the end of list) because each time the list widget is refreshed, the list is scrolled back to top.

For example, suppose the height of window can display 10 lines and I have 50 items in the list, if I want to add items 22 and 33 to the index, here is how things goes :
* I scroll down until I see item 22 and select it
* I press shift-command-= to add it 
* sourcetree adds item to the index, "files in the working tree" is refreshed showing items 1 to 10
* I scroll down until I see item 33
* I press shift-command-= to add it 
* sourcetree adds item to the index, "files in the working tree" is refreshed showing items 1 to 10

This is annoying because it interrupts the flow and forces the user to re-scan the list from the top to find the next item he wants to add to the index.

The behaviour I would prefer would be, after the selected item is added to the index, show the item just after the one originally selected by user in the middle of visible area of list and select it.
fields.summary: Refresh the "files in working tree" list panel (file status view) without losing context

fields.description:
Please allow searching in the blame window. It can be really hard to find a method as, alas, some of our legacy source files are huge.

Being able to copy and paste from the window would also be useful.
fields.summary: Allow searching in the blame window

fields.description:
There seems to be an issue around how the interactive rebase resumes after you do an amend commit.

Steps to reproduce:
- Open two seperate git projects windows in sourcetree
- On one of the projects, start an interactive rebase (I did this by right clicking a commit on the branch graph and selecting 'Rebase children of {commit hash} interactively')
- In the dialog that opens, select a commit to amend
- Click OK
- Git HEAD should now be set to the commit you wish to amend.
- Commit a change.
- The rebase should now continue

What should happen:
The rebase should finish successfully.

What actually happens:
The rebase finishes successfully, but for every other project that is open (or has been opened since sourcetree was launched), it will attempt to do a rebase on those projects.

If those projects weren't in the rebase state, it would throw up an error dialog saying theres 'Errors during Merge. No rebase in progress?'. If those projects were in a rebase state, it should try to continue the rebase.
fields.summary: Wierdness around interactive rebase, and amend commit

fields.description:
SourceTree 1.81 Mac OS X 10.8.5

I created a git repository for the first time after
updating to this version of SourceTree. I'm using embedded git.

I got this warning:
"warning: templates not found /usr/local/git/share/git-core/templates"

but the operation concluded  successfully.

Steps to produce:
Create Repository
Select Destination Path
Push "Create" button


On my system, the only git templates are in:
 /usr/share/git-core/templates

There was a similar issue reported at:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/269610/sourcetree-git-cloning-warning-templates-not-found
fields.summary: Create repository: Templates not found warning

fields.description: Please add the ability to sync Bookmarks with iCloud.
fields.summary: Sync with iCloud

fields.summary: crash when trying to add files to index

fields.description:
* click hosted repos toolbar icon in the Bookmarks window
 * system keychain confirmation dialog appears
 * clicked "Deny"
 * system confirmation dialog appears several more times
 * Sourcetree login window appears
 * Clicked Cancel
 * System keychain confirmation appears again
 * ... and so on until the end of days

EXpected behavior: 
 * login window appears after first "Deny" (bacause I'm denying access for the app not for a single account)
 * after clicking Cancel on the login window is the operation terminated
fields.summary: UI loop after denying keychain access for hosted repositories

fields.description:
It should be possible to use `--no-verify` option for push as well as it is available for commit.
I have pre-push hook and sometimes I have to bypass it. I have to use CLI then.
fields.summary: Ability to bypass push hooks
External Diff Tool Can't Be Launched Due to PATH Order

fields.description: SourceTree has becoming increasingly unstable recently. It has been crashing during rebases and while creating / switching branches.
fields.summary: BUG IN LIBDISPATCH: Resurrection of an object

A similar crash report has been posted last year already: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/209832/crash-on-commit
see also https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/283646/source-tree-crashes-when-i-try-to-commit-a-merge-changeset

fields.summary: crash on commit

fields.description:
Hello!

We use a few custom hooks to validate stuff on commit. Those hooks need to load some Python libraries listed in PYTHONPATH. When using the command line hg everything works fine, but when trying to commit from SourceTree I get errors about Python being unable to load the modules.

I tried running SourceTree from a shell session that has the proper value in PYTHONPATH but it doesn't work better. I also tried setting PYTHONPATH through launchctl (with a logout+login) but I get the same error. I'm guessing that SourceTree somehows completely overrides the PYTHONPATH when invoking hg.

Thanks!

Martin
fields.summary: Mercurial hooks depending on PYTHONPATH do not work

fields.description: It would be nice if I could update all bookmarks under a particular Group at once instead of one by one.
fields.summary: Update all bookmarks

fields.description:
All our code is written using standard text editor default tab width of 8, but when I view a file within SourceTree, it renders tabs as exactly 4 spaces (not the same as having a tab width set to 4, I cannot imagine this works well for anybody using tabs), breaking indentation alignment.

I can configure the font used for display, and would request that a configuration option for tab width be available on the same pane of the Preferences.
fields.summary: Add tab indentation / tab width support

fields.description:
I would love to see a 0 lines of context option added to the existing options of 1 3 6 12 25 50 100 lines.  Most of the time I just want to see what changed without any context at all, to see more changes in a smaller amount of space.

A screenshot is attached.
fields.summary: SourceTree: add 0 lines of context option (in addition to existing 1 3 6 12 25 50 100 lines)

fields.description: Creating a new bookmark for a new repo should be optional. I create them on a daily basis, and have therefore no use for them. It is annoying that Sourcetree asks me the name of the bookmark when creating a repo even though I do not want one.
fields.summary: Creating new repo should allow not creating a bookmark

fields.description: When I go to Preferences > Git > and change the "Push branches:" drop down / pop up, the setting does not persist. Upon returning to preferences, it flips back to "matching".
fields.summary: "Push branches" preference should not be available if the modify global config option is disabled

fields.description:
SourceTree is awesome and git-imerge is great (and maybe the future), it would be cool if we could use git-imerge directly from SourceTree instead of the Terminal.

git-imerge home: https://github.com/mhagger/git-imerge

git-imerge presentation from the GitMerge 2013 conference: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMZ2_-Ny_zc
fields.summary: Provide a way to use git-imerge -- incremental merge and rebase for git
s

fields.description:
Mid 2011 Macbook Pro
2,4 Ghz Intel Core i5
8 GB 1333 Mhz DDR3

OS X 10.9.2 (very fresh install)
Using system git 1.8.5.2
Repos on local SSD drive
4 bookmarks in SourceTree

Git status and git log are very fast, yet SourceTree is super slow to refresh changes, even when only one repo is open. I'm getting a lot of beach balls, even when trying to access the "About SourceTree" menu item. 

I'm usually in the branch view (not Working Copy) and the list of changed files in the bottom left is the worst performer.

SourceTree is often using 120% CPU or even more, when doing stuff.

Alt-tabbing to SourceTree usually results in a slow refresh as well, blocking the entire app. When pressing the Commit button it usually takes a couple of seconds for the window to popup.

All my colleagues have the same problems, and it all started a couple of months ago. It's sadly come to the point where SourceTree is no longer usable.
fields.summary: Huge performance problems

fields.description:
Rebase with a conflict. Right-click the conflict and "Resolve Using Mine." The diff will show, as expected, that the conflict was resolved using your own side of the branch. (See attachment: Screen Shot 2014-04-07 at 10.25.52 AM.png).

Abort the rebase to start over. This time, "Resolve Using Theirs." The diff shows that "Mine" overwrote "Theirs" rather than "Theirs" overwriting "Mine." (See attachment: Screen Shot 2014-04-07 at 10.27.10 AM.png)

I've been able to reproduce this a few times and maybe I just don't understand Mine vs. Theirs, but I am under the impression that when I choose "Theirs" the code I'm rebasing with should overwrite my own.

Screenshots of my workflow are attached in the order that reproduces what I think is a bug, but again, if my understanding is wrong, please let me know and feel free to close the issue. (Sorry, somehow I attached the same screenshot twice in a row.)

I've marked this as "Critical" only because, without inspection, it can be very easy to finish the rebase and overwrite the code you intended to keep, effectively losing data.
fields.summary: "Resolve Using Theirs" does the same thing as "Resolve Using Mine"

fields.description:
Hi.
I have repo where is 4k+ commits, i am opening sourcetree, press 'all branches' button, trying to scroll commits down, but with no luck, list is jumping back to up, impossible to see old commits.
fields.summary: Big list with commits does not scroll down

fields.description: I'd like to be able to open a selected commit on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Link to a commit on Bitbucket

fields.description:
1. Can't use a ref that contains a forward slash (e.g. stable/1.6.x for the Django project) when adding/linking a subtree.

2. Can't squash when adding/linking subtree.

3. I often get errors about missing paths after removing a subtree.

4. Local edits to files within the subtree don't show up as pending.
fields.summary: Problems with Subtree support.

fields.description: Pull has never worked in Sourcetree. We have managed to work around it by just using Fetch first then Merge. which I realize is the same thing in essence but some how the pull doesn't  quite do it the same as triggering the individual processes on their own. The problem usually has something to do with either writing to the Head  or rewriting over a Head that is already there. I don't have an image of the error. I have learned not to touch Pull because I have to re-clone the repository afterwords because it messes up the git install so much.
fields.summary: Pull does not work in sourcetree

fields.description: When no files are selected and you hit 'Reset' from the main menu, it does nothing. It should be disabled if no files are selected.
fields.summary: Reset does nothing when no files are selected

fields.description: Right now we have 'Discard file' option when doing it at a file-level, but the main menu has 'Reset'. This is logged elsewhere but users are right, they think the two operations do two different things, which they don't. Make sure there's some common ground here.
fields.summary: Discard/Reset. Common ground language needed!

fields.description:
When creating an archive, if you do not include a file extension, the dialog that comes up is showing *InvalidArchiveFormatTitle* & *InvalidArchiveFormatMsg*, instead of a _"real"_ title and message.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Invalid Archive Format dialog is incomplete

fields.description:
Users just can't figure out how to login to MAC using SourceTree. They get their license the manual way, and when I often tell them they have no idea.

My suggestion: have two separate buttons, one for 'Register' and the other for 'Login to my.atlassian.com'. If they haven't logged in / registered yet perhaps have just one big screen that can do all of this instead. Both can determine if an account exists or not, anyway.
fields.summary: 'Register' should be changed to 'Register / Login'

fields.description: Noted all here; https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/273521/sourcetree-stalls-severely-when-computing-diffs-on-minified-javascript-files
fields.summary: Diff rendering slowness

fields.description:
I was mystified to find feature requests for sorting the bookmarks menu alphabetically that had been closed as of 1.4 - I've been using 1.8 for awhile now and was sure the feature didn't exist.

Finally for the first time today I created a folder and dragged some bookmarks in, and also for the first time right-clicked in the bookmarks window, and saw a context menu allowing sorting of what's in the folder. Also noticed the items are disabled if you just select all repositories at the top level.

This is a UX improvement request to make a real, helpful sort feature part of the GUI, and have it work on bookmarks in the window regardless of whether they are in a folder. The feature you have is so hidden I used the product for months, looking for it repeatedly, and was convinced it wasn't there. Even a preference setting "Sort bookmarks by name" would be more visible and intuitive than what's there now. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: bookmark sorting is unintuitive, and impossible without folders

fields.description: Each time I try and commit after a successful push the app crashes and I need to relaunch.  The commit dialog loads fine, I enter my comments and then when I click the commit button the crash happens.  When I relaunch the app the commit goes through fine.  Actually, the commit message I had previously typed in before the crash is now selectable in the recent messages dropdown after the crash happens and I relaunch.
fields.summary: Crash on next commit after every push

fields.description:
Currently, it seems that the sourcetree:// scheme supports only the following:

* checkoutRef
* cloneRepo

Although I was unable to find the protocol anywhere online in order to know for sure, testing various URLs failed to show a way of simply opening/viewing a local repository (or bookmarked repository or working copy) in SourceTree.

I also submitted a question to Atlassian Answers (see link below), and in fact I am raising this feature request at the suggestion of the responder. 

(As it happens, I eventually created my own custom URL scheme that opens a local repository in SourceTree, but still it would be nice to have it supported natively.)

More details here:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/277682/does-sourcetree-openrepo-or-similar-exist
fields.summary: Implementing sourcetree://openRepo (or similar)

fields.description:
Currently, the recently opened list as shown in the OSX dock context menu is showing the folder name of the project and not the project name.

This is unhelpful if (as in my case) all the folders simply say 'src' as this is the standard folder for storing code under.

Please can this be changed to the project name as defined by the user.
fields.summary: use project names for dock 'recent' context menu

fields.description: Please see screenshot. Nothing is opened !!!
fields.summary: Open current version command from right click menu on a selected file DOES NOT WORK

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to expand current choice user presented when SourceTree is not able to locate local repo from Bookmarks window.

Currently there are 3 choices:

Change Folder
Cancel
Delete Bookmark

Please add ability to re pull repo from remote (if remote repo was originally configured).

I also attached some screenshots to illustrate what is required.
fields.summary: Bookmarks: Ability to re-pull repo from remote if it can not be found on local disk

fields.description:
while it is possible to diff even between arbitrary commits, it always compares in date order as per answer on https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/194632/sourcetree-how-to-do-a-diff-in-the-opposite-direction

in order to better see merge results, it would be an absolutely outstanding feature to be able to flip the direction of the diff comparision. Apart from git's commandline there doesn't seem to be any good solution out there and is the only thing that I am missing from SourceTree - everything else is perfect!
fields.summary: Allow to diff between branches/commits in opposite direction

fields.description:
Using the command line I can set a different Push URL for a remote, e.g.

{code}git remote set-url --push origin git@<my-fork-of-forked-repo>{code}

and then {{git remote show origin}} will report

{code}* remote origin
  Fetch URL: git@<forked-repo>
  Push URL: git@<my-fork-of-forked-repo>{code}

I really like setting up my remotes like this because based on my workflow I'm "logically" pushing to the <forked-repo> even though I'm "physically" pushing to <my-fork-of-forked-repo>.

Git Extensions enables you to set a separate Push URL in it UI. Sadly, SourceTree reports the Push URL as the (only) URL of the remote. It would be nice if it could indicate that the repo has separate Fetch and Push URLs.
fields.summary: UI for Remote URLs Should Handle Remotes with Different Fetch and Push URLs

fields.description:
SourceTree keeps on crashing all the time (and I keep submitting crash reports via the Apple built-in feature) and many times a day I get to a state where it's either trying to figure out the constant changing of my source directories (as I keep it open all the time) where it just freezes up and I have to Force quit it. This happens more frequently than I'd like to admit and my peers keep on pushing for us to switch to Tower based on some of these issues.

I'd love to keep on using SourceTree, I think it's a great product (and Attlassian  is a great company) but with issues like that it makes it hard to justify it.

See attached my latest freeze report after force quitting it.
fields.summary: Freezing and Crashing all the time

fields.description:

fields.summary: SourceTree Does Not Create New Stashes When List Contains Stash With Space

fields.description: From here: https://twitter.com/aeberbach/status/448396339575939073
fields.summary: If Kaleidoscope command line tools aren't installed error message is empty

fields.description:
Working Copy doesn't automatically update changed files.

I now have to manually refresh (CMD+R) to update my changed files, in the Working Copy.

This started when using the same local repository on a different Mac, shared with Dropbox.
fields.summary: Working Copy not updating changed files

fields.description: Reported here: https://twitter.com/jonheller/status/447074909844672512
fields.summary: NSFileHandle issue (reported via Twitter)

fields.description: When the last repo window is closed, have SourceTree remember which repo that was, and then have that repo re-open automatically when the app is launched, or the Dock icon is clicked. This could be controlled by a general preference such as "Reopen last used bookmark automatically".
fields.summary: Reopen last used bookmark automatically

fields.description: Have the "Keep bookmarks closed on startup" option also prevent the bookmarks window from appearing when you click the SourceTree icon in the Dock. With possibly renaming the option to "Keep bookmarks closed at startup and when bringing to front".
fields.summary: Keep bookmarks closed at startup and when bringing to front

fields.description:
Context: I am using SourceTree to browse a git-annex repository. A checked-in file is a symlink which points to the real content somewhere else. The "git annex unlock" operation replaces the symlink with the real file for editing. Then the working copy is dirty, but SourceTree shows no changes. "git status" in the commandline correctly shows unstaged "typechange: ..." changes.

Summary: SourceTree should display a file as changed even if it is only a "typechange".

I don't have verified but I suspect this behaviour is also present in the windows version.
fields.summary: typechange not visible

fields.description:
I was two commits ahead of origin. Squashed down to a single commit, but the "Push" button's badge continued to display "2 ahead" rather than "1". 

Dropping to cmd line, get status confirmed I was only 1 commit ahead of remote.
fields.summary: Squashing commits does not update Badge on "Push" button

fields.summary: Crash after focusing in Sourcetree window

fields.description:
On multiple occasions, I have selected a commit in the main SourceTree window and clicked "Tag" in the menu bar, expecting the tag to be applied to the commit I selected.  However, the tag gets applied to the working copy rather than the selected commit unless you specifically choose the commit again in the tagging dialog window.

The checkout feature already automatically chooses the currently selected commit.  It would be convenient if the tagging feature did as well.
fields.summary: Pressing "Tag" should tag the selected commit rather than the working copy

fields.description:
1) Make sure the Log tab is selected in the main window of an open project with a branch tracking a remote.
1) Repository -> Repository Settings... -> Remotes
2) Select a remote.
3) Click Edit.
4) Change the Remote Name field.
5) Click OK.
6) Click OK in the parent dialog.
7) Note that the remote name hasn't changed in the Log view.
8) Repository -> Refresh Remote Status
9) Boom.
fields.summary: Crash every time I rename a remote

fields.description:
1) Choose Repository -> Repository Settings from menu
2) Click "Add"
3) Press Tab

Expected:
The Tab key should move the cursor to the second field; it doesn't.

Notes:
Shift+Tab doesn't work as well.
fields.summary: Tab navigation is broken in Repository Settings modal dialog

fields.description: If you use two-factor authentication with GitHub, obviously accessing the API via username+password pair won't work. SourceTree should be able to use the OAuth API; I'd register a token for SourceTree with correct permissions and the app would use it.
fields.summary: SourceTree can't use OAuth GitHub API for clients with two-factor authentication enabled

fields.description:
Please add support for BeyondCompare file compare and merge tool.

Until recently BeyondCompare was available only for Windows and Linux, but now is also available for Mac.

Here you can find instructions regarding manual configuration for BeyondCompare.

This is a request to add BeyondCompare to the list of recognized diff/merge tool.
fields.summary: Add support for BeyondCompare

fields.description:
SourceTree periodically hangs and has to be force-quit.

I will attach some spin logs and/or crash reports to this issue the next few times it happens.
fields.summary: I'm getting regular hangs when using Source Tree with git

fields.description:
Fresh install of SourTree.
While looking trough Console for my other bug report from today I saw alot of CrashReports for SourceTree git. As I am still busy getting anything setup I cannot tell what is or is not working with the actual git commands. But since I do not understand wether these issues are connected I thought it prudent to file them separetly.
fields.summary: Silent git crash, EXC_BAD_ACCESS (SIGSEV)

fields.description:
Fresh install of SourceTree.
Start Wizard.
Continue to page 2: Connect to online services.
Try to Setup Bitbucket:
After entering anything in the field username for Bitbucket neither of buttons "Skip" or "Next" will work.
Controlled by
a) Correct username from Bitbucket (not Atlassian ID username)
b) clearing field username and password allows to advance to page 3, but not to "Skip"
c) Never entering anything on page 2 allows "Skip"

In Mac Console SourceTree produces Messages and Crash reports.
fields.summary: Wizard fails silently on SourceTree for Mac

fields.description:
When scrolling file diff inside 'Branches' view scroll bar is flickering. Same does not happen when scrolling diff in 'Working Copy' view.

See GIF attached.
fields.summary: Blinking scrollbar

fields.description:
The "New Commit Available" notifications that appear in the French version are titled:

"Nouveau S'engager Disponible"

That is wrong and non-sensical.

Although it is not an accepted French word per-say, you do use the word "commit" everywhere else in the UI.

It would make much more sense for the notification message to read:

"Nouveau commit disponible"
fields.summary: Bad French localisation for "New Commit Available" notifications

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a simple Custom Action:

If I have a spaces in filename or file path putting them in quotes results in the following error message. Please refer to attached screens.

Screen 1: Workaround without spaces

Screen 2: Custom Action Setup with spaces in file path
Screen 3: Error
fields.summary: Custom actions do not allow spaces in file paths

fields.description:
Actions needing confirmation in modal dialogs, like deleting a branch on a remote trigger those modal dialogs in wrong screens. In my current setup I have a couple of Spaces on both my main laptop screen and on an external one. SourceTree windows are placed on the external one.

The modal dialog appears on the laptop screen and on a specific space (number 3 for me). If I'm currently on Space 1 and I trigger a modal dialog, it appears on the Space 3 with no indication it did appear other than complete UI blockage - I cannot click anywhere inside the SourceTree window. I suspect the modal dialog is the cause but then I have to cycle through my spaces to hunt for this window - a terrible UX.

This is seriously hampering my productivity.
fields.summary: Modal dialogs appear on wrong screens, blocking the UI
